ngiemboon: N gyá sɔɔn shúm tà ńtsẅé jʉʼ, e Ssé gíŋ ńnyɛ́ʼ nÿɔ́g mɔ́ɔn, n gyá Múɔ Njʉ̀njÿò, á tyé ndùm lekwɔʼɔ́ Siyoŋ. Pâ pʉ̀a ntsáʼ ntsɔ̀b lekùɔ lé móm lekùɔ nzèm ntsáʼ nkÿo gwɔ́ (144 000). Mbà mé la ŋweʼe lezíŋ Múɔ Njʉ̀njÿò mbɔɔ se Tá we á na zǐ sɔ́b.
en: Then I looked, and there was the Lamb, standing on Mount Zion,   and with him were 144,000 who had his name and his Father’s name written on their foreheads.  # 14:1 Dt 6:8; Ezk 9:4; Rv 3:12; 7:3; 9:4; 13:16; 22:4

ngiemboon: N júʼ etsɔ̌ ngyè nyìŋ fó tÿǒ lepwó, ńzẅɛ páʼ máamáa ntse gẅie é ne ńzyɛ́ʼɛ la, ńgíŋ ńgwɔ́ páʼ lefaŋ sie é vɛ́te la, ńgíŋ ńgwɔ́ páʼ ngyè leluŋó gie papúʼ tsɔ̌ ntí kèkÿɛ̀ ne ḿbúʼu la.
en: I heard a sound   from heaven like the sound of cascading waters  # 14:2 Ezk 1:24; 43:2; Rv 1:15; 19:6 and like the rumbling of loud thunder. The sound I heard was like harpists playing on their harps.  # 14:2 Rv 5:8

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tyé mvfò lʉŋe lefùɔ, mbɔɔ mvfò menɔ̀ɔn pa lekùɔ lâ mvfò melÿò pɛ̌, ńne ńzɔbɔ tsɔ́ zɔ̀bɔ ntse sẅé, é té ndàʼ pʉ̀a ntsáʼ ntsɔ̀b lekùɔ lé móm lekùɔ nzèm ntsáʼ nkÿo (144 000) pie mé la cuʼu wɔ́b ndá nkwɔɔn ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ wɔ́, mbà tsɔ̌ nyìŋ la te wó tà ńkuʼu lézíʼi yɛ̌ zɔ̀bɔ ntse tà ńzɔb wɔ́,
en: They sang   a new song  # 14:3 Rv 5:9 before the throne and before the four living creatures and the elders,  # 14:3 Rv 4:4,6 but no one could learn the song except the 144,000 who had been redeemed from the earth.

ngiemboon: ée pʉ̀a pie pâ panzwě la te gÿo menò ncÿǒ wɔ́, pɔ́ gwɔ́ pɔ́ pʉ̀a pie é laa manzwě zsé. Múɔ Njʉ̀njÿò gʉa nzɔ̌ wɔ́ɔ, pɔ́ zse pɔ́ nzèm ye, ée pʉ̀a pie mé la gʉa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a mesoŋ ńcuʼu wɔ́b, pɔ́ gwɔ́ mvfò Ssé mbɔɔ mvfò Múɔ Njʉ̀njÿò, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ ntwó mmó gie é fǒ nkáʼ la,
en: These are the ones who have not defiled themselves with women, since they remained virgins.   These are the ones who follow the Lamb wherever he goes. They were redeemed  # 14:4 Other mss add by Jesus from humanity as the firstfruits  # 14:4 Dt 21:17; Jr 2:3; Jms 1:18 for God and the Lamb.

ngiemboon: mbà mé laa mé ńjúʼ cÿɔ̌nò kẅɛɛ ncwò pɔ́b wɔ́, alɔ̌ʼ yɔ́b té wó wɔ́.
en: No lie was found in their mouths; they are blameless.

ngiemboon: N gíŋ ńgyá tsɔ̌ tàʼ Cÿɔ́ʼ Ssé gwɔ́ tàa tÿǒ lefaŋ ńne ńzie, ńgẅiin tsɔ́ nkʉ̀ mbòŋo gẅie ée we temì, páʼ à ge gʉa tsẅii mbwó pʉ̀a pie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ, á tsɛ̀ɛ mbɔɔ wɛ̌ ngwòŋ wɔ́ɔ, á mbwó mbɔɔ yɛ̌ ngẅɛ̀ wɔ́ɔ, á mbwó pashwóŋo yɛ̌ ntí shwóŋè wɔ́ɔ, á mbwó yɛ̌ ntí ntí nyìŋ mesoŋ wɔ́ɔ.
en: Then I saw another angel   flying high overhead,  # 14:6 Rv 8:13 with the eternal gospel to announce to the inhabitants of the earth #— #to every nation, tribe, language, and people.  # 14:6 Rv 5:9; 7:9; 11:9; 13:7

ngiemboon: Á ne ńdɔgɔ ngyè tetʉ̂ ńgɔɔn ngie: «Pi pɔ́g Ssé, ńnáa legúʼ mbwó yé. Á nue afʉ̀ʼ gie à ge ŋag pʉ̀a mesoŋ, áa páʼɔɔn mbà á kǔʼ. Pi ŋwɔ́ʼ nnɛ́ mvfò nyìŋ gẅie à la nyɛte lepwó, ńnyɛte tsetsáʼ, ńnyɛte ntse tépàa, ńnyɛte mbɔɔ mesaʼá ntse!»
en: He spoke with a loud voice:   “Fear God  # 14:7 Gn 22:12; 42:18; Ps 66:16; Ec 5:7; 12:13; Ac 13:16,26; 1Pt 2:17 and give him glory,  # 14:7 Jos 7:19; 1Sm 6:5; Jr 13:16; Lk 17:18; Rv 4:9; 16:9; 19:7 because the hour of his judgment has come.  # 14:7 Rv 18:10 Worship the one who made heaven and earth,  # 14:7 Ps 115:15; 121:2; 124:8; 134:3; 146:6 the sea and the springs of water.”

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ cÿɔ́ʼ Ssé, ńgwɔ́ mbɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a pɔ́ɔnte ńne ńgɔɔn ngie: «À kéen ńgwe ssé, ngie à kéen ńgwe ssé. N gɔɔn máamáa tÿǒsoŋo Mbambilonia gie á ka ne ńgÿo ngwòŋo ngwòŋ ne ńnúu melùʼ mpfwɔ̀ʼ mé, é mpfwɔ̀ʼ gie é pǔ ńtɔ́g ntí.»
en: And another, a second angel, followed, saying, “It has fallen, Babylon the Great   has fallen.  # 14:8 Other mss omit the second has fallen She made all the nations drink the wine of her sexual immorality,  # 14:8 Or wine of her passionate immorality which brings wrath.”  # 14:8 Is 21:9; Jr 51:7–8,49; Rv 17:2,4; 18:2–3

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ cÿɔ́ʼ Ssé, ńgwɔ́ mbɔ́ɔntè yétá pɔ́ɔnte wɔ́b, ńne ńdɔgɔ ngyè tetʉ̂ ńgɔɔn ngie: «Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńŋwɔ́ʼ nnɛ́ mvfò nɔ̀ɔn mbɔɔ mvfò tútú we, ńzẅíŋ mé cÿɔʼɔ liŋé nɔ̀ɔn na zǐ yé, kà na pwó yé wɔ́ɔ,
en: And another, a third angel, followed them and spoke with a loud voice: “If anyone worships the beast and its image and receives a mark on his forehead or on his hand,

ngiemboon: angàŋ zsé ngie mbɔɔ yé yé ge gÿo nú melùʼ gyáŋalóŋ Ssé, é mie Ssé ge gÿo néŋe tsɛ̀ɛ ntúʼ gyáŋalóŋ yé, tà fó le gwate. Angàŋ pɔ́ɔnte ńkú ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ á tsɛ̀ɛ mmɔ̌g mekʉ̀a, á mvfò mecÿɔ́ʼ Ssé pe ndʉalʉ̌a mbɔɔ mvfò Múɔ Njʉ̀njÿò.
en: he will also drink the wine of God’s wrath, which is poured full strength into the cup of his anger.   He will be tormented with fire and sulfur  # 14:10 Lk 17:29; Rv 20:10; 21:8 in the sight of the holy angels and in the sight of the Lamb,

ngiemboon: Ndyé mmɔ̌g gẅie pɔ́ ée tsoló e láʼa ńzɔ́gɔ ńkwɔ́ʼɔ kwɔ̌ʼ na ngùʼ nkɔ́ɔn né nkɔ́ɔn. Awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ gẅie à ne ńŋwɔ́ʼɔ nnɛ́ mvfò nɔ̀ɔn, ńgíŋe ńne ńguʼte tútú nɔ̀ɔn ŋwɛ́, tà mbà mé cÿɔʼɔ́ liŋé lezíŋ nɔ̀ɔn na yé, à láʼa ńzɔ́gɔ légyá ngɔ́ʼ á zsǒ mbɔɔ tsẅɛ́ʼ, atsɔ̌ lézẅɛte á le gwɔ́ wó wɔ́.»
en: and the smoke of their torment will go up forever and ever.   There is no rest  # 14:11 Or They have no rest,# 14:11 Ps 22:2; Is 23:12; 62:6; Jr 45:3; Lm 2:18 day or night for those who worship the beast and its image, or anyone who receives the mark  # 14:11 Gn 4:15; Ex 12:13; Ezk 9:4,6; Rv 13:16; 16:2; 19:20 of its name.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn nò lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie epʉ̀a Ssé, é pʉ̀a pie é kúʼte lepʉ̌ Ssé, ńzába ntʉ́m na Yěsô, pɔ́ shÿɔg.
en: This calls for endurance from the saints,   who keep God’s commands and their faith in Jesus.”  # 14:12 Or and the faith of Jesus, or and faithfulness to Jesus

ngiemboon: N júʼ tsɔ̌ ngyè nyìŋ fó tÿǒ lepwó ńgɔɔn ngie: «Ŋweʼe ngie: “Á ge fó fʉ̀ʼɔɔn, pashÿó mbòŋo gwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie é ge gwaa kwé, é kwé ncwò fàʼ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a!” A Zẅìge ndʉalʉ̌a zẅíŋ ngie: “Áa nò, epɛ̌ pʉ̀a ge gʉa zẅɛte na mefàʼ lÿò mɔ́b. Á nue pɔ́ ge lɔgɔ Píte mefàʼ mɔ́b é gʉa!”»
en: Then I heard a voice from heaven saying, “Write: Blessed are the dead who die in the Lord from now on.”

ngiemboon: N gyá sɔɔn shúm tà ńtsẅé jʉʼ, e Ssé gíŋ ńnyɛ́ʼ nÿɔ́g mɔ́ɔn, n gwóon ńgyá tsɔ̌ féfɔ́gɔ melɔ́ɔn, nyìŋ néŋe ndumó ńgwɔ́ páʼ Míŋ Nyìŋ mesoŋ la, ńtɔʼɔ cÿɔ̀ʼɔ lefùɔ gie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ ńnyɛte, ńgẅiin tsɔ̌ ntí nně gie mé lɔgɔ ńdaga shúm nkáʼ, é ne ńdúmo tɛʼ.
en: Then I looked, and there was a white cloud, and one like the Son of Man  ,# 14:14 Dn 7:13; Lk 21:27; Rv 1:13 was seated on the cloud, with a golden crown on his head and a sharp sickle in his hand.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ cÿɔ́ʼ Ssé fó tsɛ̀ɛ jʉʼʉ ssé gie áa tÿǒ lepwó, ńdɔg ngyè tetʉ̂ ńtsẅii mbwó nyìŋ gẅie à néŋe ndùm féfɔ́gɔ melɔ́ɔn la ngie: «Lɔg nně ńdag shúm, ńdag shúm ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ. Afʉ̀ʼʉ lélag shúm kǔʼ, á nue shúm ée ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ, mbà é tʉ̌ʉ.»
en: Another angel came out of the temple, crying out in a loud voice to the one who was seated on the cloud, “Use your sickle and reap, for the time to reap has come, since the harvest of the earth is ripe.”

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie á kɔʼɔ́ ńnéŋe ndùm féfɔ́gɔ melɔ́ɔn la leen ńké ḿmaʼ nně ye, ńdɔg ńdag shúm ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ á jʉʼ ntsem.
en: So the one seated on the cloud swung his sickle over the earth, and the earth was harvested.

ngiemboon: Wetsɔ̌ cÿɔ́ʼ Ssé fó tsɛ̀ɛ jʉʼʉ Ssé gie áa tÿǒ lepwó ńkẅɛ, ńgíŋ ńgẅiin yé ntí nně ya gie mé lɔgɔ ńdaga shúm nkáʼ la, é ne ńdúmo tɛʼ.
en: Then another angel who also had a sharp sickle came out of the temple in heaven.

ngiemboon: Wetsɔ̌ cÿɔ́ʼ Ssé fó jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ ńkẅɛ, ńgwɔ́ gẅie mé la cʉ́me nò mmɔ̌g mbwó yé, á lɔg ngyè tetʉ̂, ńtsẅii mbwó gẅie á kɔʼɔ́ ńgẅiin nně, é ne ńdúmo tɛʼ la ngie: «Maʼ nně jù gie e ne ńdúmo lɛ̂, ńdɔg ńzáʼ mencùɔ mentɔ̌ɔn tÿǒ melùʼ, mie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ, mbà é tʉ̌ lɛ̂.»
en: Yet another angel, who had authority over fire, came from the altar, and he called with a loud voice to the one who had the sharp sickle, “Use your sharp sickle and gather the clusters of grapes from the vineyard of the earth, because its grapes have ripened.”

ngiemboon: Cÿɔ́ʼ Ssé lɔg nně ye, ńgʉa ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ, ńzáʼ mencùɔ mentɔ̌ɔn metÿǒ melùʼ, á tsɛ̀ɛ nkáʼa metÿǒ melùʼ mie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ, ḿbÿɛɛ tsɛ̀ɛ máamáa gÿǒon, á jʉʼ gie mé kyéen mentɔ̌ɔn wó, ńgẅiin melùʼ. Lekyěen tsɛ̀ɛ gÿǒon ŋwɛ́ lɔgɔ ńdaʼte gyáŋalóŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: So the angel swung his sickle at the earth and gathered the grapes from the vineyard of the earth, and he threw them into the great winepress of God’s wrath.

ngiemboon: Mé fó tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋ ńkẅɛ tá ńgyá yɛ̌ gÿǒon. Mé léen ńtsẅɛ́ʼ mentɔ̌ɔn ŋwɛ́ tsoló, metse zɔ̌ fó tsɛ̀ɛ gÿǒon ŋwɛ́ ńkẅɛ, ńcwóŋo na mekílòmítà nkÿo tá, lecǔu ssé gwɔ́ na ntí gie mé laa péʼe ńtÿɔ́gɔ lÿóon jʉʼó, mbà ngwɔ́ é kwɔ́ʼ tà ńkúu na kwáŋ gẅie aa ncwò yé.
en: Then the press was trampled outside the city, and blood flowed out of the press up to the horses’ bridles for about 180 miles.  ,# 14:20 Is 63:1–6
